header.type: HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: Vuyani Sokupa.  We welcome you.  Please get up to take the oath.
Thank you.  You may sit down.  Ntsiki Sandi will lead you in evidence.
Thank you Mr Chairman.  Mr Sokupa, you said that in 1985 you were the organiser of which organisation?
Then you were arrested by the Ciskeian Police and you were beaten up.  Where were you arrested, where did they keep you?
They arrested you, they arrested me from NU12.
You were being asked about a policeman that had been killed.

They were not asking me anything, Boutie just arrested me.  He said that I was holding meetings at my place.  We were in a truck and he said that we were going, he saw me at NU7.  He said that we will meet at NU12.
Let us talk about the details of your torture.
They took me from the truck, arrested me.  They took sjamboks and beat me up.
Yes, my left eye does not see properly.  I often have headaches.  I have, I had, I sustained internal injuries.
You also have a loss of memory?
And this was caused by the ill-treatment?
Yes, I was beaten up the most.
Did you go to a hospital?
You lost a job after you were beaten up.  Where did you work?  Please come closer to the mike.
Did they give you reasons for your loss of employment?
No, well I was not satisfied even with the salary that they were giving me.
I have a 14 year old child.  I do not have a job.  If the Commission could help me.

Thank you Vuyani for your short evidence that you were beaten up.  They would beat you up.  We are going to investigate as to why Boutie beat you up.  Thank you Vuyani.  We cannot give you answers at the moment.  We are going to report to the President and we will take it from there.  Thank you.  You may step down.
